definitions.definition: The part of an animal's body between the base of the neck and forearm socket.

subdefinitions.definition: The part of the human torso forming a relatively horizontal surface running away from the neck.
examples: The parrot was sitting on Steve's shoulder .

subdefinitions.definition: The joint between the arm and the torso , sometimes including the surrounding muscles, tendons, and ligaments.
A cut of meat comprising the upper joint of the foreleg and the surrounding muscle.
The portion of a garment where the shoulder is clothed.

definitions.definition: Anything forming a shape resembling a human shoulder.

subdefinitions.definition: A usually unsealed strip of land bordering a road , where vehicles can drive or park in an emergency.
examples: He stopped the car on the shoulder of the highway to change the flat tire.

subdefinitions.definition: The portion of a hill or mountain just below the peak.
A lateral protrusion of a hill or mountain .
The angle of a bastion included between the face and flank .
An abrupt projection which forms an abutment on an object, or limits motion, etc., such as the projection around a tenon at the end of a piece of timber .

definitions.definition: The flat portion of type that is below the bevelled portion that joins up with the face .
The portion between the neck and the body.

subdefinitions.definition: The rounded portion of a stringed instrument where the neck joins the body.
The rounded portion of a bottle where the neck meets the body.
The angled section between the neck and the main body of a cartridge .

definitions.definition: That which supports or sustains; support .
The part of a key between the cuts and the bow. Parts of a Yale lock-type key
The part of a wave that has not yet broken .
A season or a time of day when there is relatively little air traffic .

main_definition: The part of an animal's body between the base of the neck and forearm socket.
secondary_definitions: Anything forming a shape resembling a human shoulder.
( topography ) A shelf between two levels.
( printing ) The flat portion of type that is below the bevelled portion that joins up with the face .
( of an object ) The portion between the neck and the body.
( figurative ) That which supports or sustains; support .
The part of a key between the cuts and the bow. Parts of a Yale lock-type key
( surfing ) The part of a wave that has not yet broken .
( aviation ) A season or a time of day when there is relatively little air traffic .
